revised_title: Marsupial Pouches, Mammary Glands, and Mammary Foetus in Echidna Hystrix
tldr: The author examines the reproductive and anatomical features of the Echidna Hystrix, a monotreme, and discovers marsupial pouches and mammary glands similar to those found in other marsupials. The young Echidna is nourished by the mother's milk through the mammary glands, which are connected to the pouches. This study provides insight into the reproductive biology of monotremes and their unique reproductive strategies.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental biology
